task.title: Create Launch Configuration
task.shortdesc: This screen allows you create a new launch configuration. The launch configuration is used to define the parameters for new instances that are launched as part of your auto scaling group. For more information on Auto Scaling, please see Using Auto Scaling in the Eucalyptus User Guide.

task.title: Select an Image
task.shortdesc: This panel allows you to select a base image to use for creating instances in your auto scaling group.

step.cmd: Refine and filter your results by typing search criteria into the Search text box.
Select an image by clicking on the image in the Select image list.
Click the Next: Select type button to proceed to the Type panel.

task.title: Select a Type
task.shortdesc: This panel allows you to specify the instance size for new instance in your auto scaling group.

step.cmd: Type the name of your launch configuration into the Name text box.
Select an instance size from the Instance size drop-down list..

info.note: Information about the instance size is displayed when you click the instance size link.

step.cmd: Click the Next: Select security button to proceed to the Security panel.

task.title: Specify Security
task.shortdesc: This panel allows you to specify the key pair and security group that will be used by the new instances in your auto scaling group NOTE: if you create a key pair or security group in this section, they will automatically be selected for use in your new instances.

step.cmd: Select a key pair using the Key pair drop-down list box.

info.note: You can also create a new key pair by clicking the Create new key pair link to display the Create new key pair dialog box.

step.cmd: Select a security group using the Security group drop-down list box.

info.note: You can also create a new security group by clicking the Create new security group link to display the Create new security group dialog box.
If you select the default security group, make sure that you've added rules to the default security group so that you can access your instances.

step.cmd: You can optionally specify advanced options by clicking the Select advanced options link.

task.title: Specify Advanced Options
task.shortdesc: This panel allows you to specify advanced options for the new instance in your auto scaling group. You can add user data, override the kernel and RAM disk IDs, specify private networking, and add additional storage.

step.cmd: Specify custom user data by typing it into the User data text box or by attaching a file by clicking the Choose file button.
You can override the kernel ID in the selected image with the Kernel ID drop-down list box.
You can override the RAM disk ID in the selected image with the RAM disk ID drop-down list box.

You can optionally choose to create a new auto scaling group based on this launch configuration by selecting the Create scaling group using this launch configuration check box. When this is selected, the New Scaling Group dialog will display after you've clicked the Create launch configuration button, with the Launch configuration field pre-populated with the name of your new launch configuration.
Click the Create launch configuration button.

taskbody.result: For more information on Auto Scaling, see the Eucalyptus User Guide.
